description: To mitigate the identified issue associated with CVE-2023-36435, you need to apply the relevant updates for the affected systems. For Windows 11 version 22H2 for x64-based systems, the update is KB5031354, and can be downloaded from the link: https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5031354. For Windows 11 version 21H2 for x64-based systems, apply update KB5031358 available at: https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5031358. Additionally, for Windows 10 for x64-based systems, the solution requires KB5031901, downloadable here: https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5031901. If you are using Windows Server 2022, both KB5031364 patches apply, one for the server core installation and one for the full installation, accessible at: https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5031364. Lastly, PowerShell 7.3 has been newly recognized as impacted, and updating is recommended for users of that version. Ensure to verify the installation of all relevant updates to ensure complete protection against the impacts of this issue.
